Rabies cases increase in northeastern Thailand

Dr. Tawichai of the 9th Disease Prevention and Management Office revealed on February 9 that rabies infections have been increasing in northeastern Thailand over the past few months, with a total of 74 people infected.
So far this year (October last year to September this year), 74 people have tested positive for rabies in the northeastern provinces of Srinagar and Bhiramnagar.
It's said that everyone has received rabies vaccine in the past.
The doctor is urging people to get rabies vaccinations with their pets and to avoid touching the saliva of animals suspected of being infected.
Rabies can be contracted from cats and rats as well as dogs.
If a person is infected and develops the disease, they will almost certainly die, but if they are vaccinated before they develop the disease, they can be saved.

FUJI Placement and Accident Prevention System Development Experiment on Own Vehicles | Midland Economic Newspaper Economic Information on Aichi, Gifu, Mie, and Shizuoka

Fujitsu (headquarters in Chiyoda City), which manufactures and sells electronic parts mounting robots and work machines, has taken on the development of a system to prevent "abandonment" such as leaving children in cars.
A system that attaches a human detection sensor to the car and sends a notification to the phone or chat when it detects movement.
Currently, we are conducting a demonstration experiment using our own vehicles.
In the midst of painful accidents caused by carelessness, protect the safety of children.
Currently, two vehicles are being used to conduct a trial run of the child-oriented English conversation after-school program "teracoya thank (tera ko ya san k)" that is operated by the city.
A human sensor that detects human movement based on the temperature difference between people and their surroundings is installed in three places on the ceiling of the vehicle.
If the vehicle's engine is turned off and the door is closed, and if a person's movement is detected after a certain period of time, a warning notification will be automatically sent.
By linking the status of the engine and doors, we can prevent misjudgment as much as possible.
The warning notification is sent through the cloud.
You can either call the number you registered in advance or display it on your computer or smartphone chat.
You can register multiple addresses, and it's designed to prevent mistakes like forgetting to add an address.
The experiment will continue until the end of February.
Shinmatsu Isoroku, head of the second section of the Innovation Promotion Department, pointed out, "During the experiment, we also saw peripheral issues that are not part of the system."
For example, it was able to pick up various issues related to school buses, such as creating an environment where drivers can concentrate on driving.
I'll put my strength into it if we can spread the solution.
The development of the disposal prevention system was prompted by the successive disposal accidents of the shuttle buses across the country.
A member with young children asked if there was anything we could do to protect the safety of children.
In order to utilize the know-how of IoT and sensor information management, which was cultivated through the FAA (Factory Automation) related business, we decided to develop it.
Fujis removal prevention system is all about convenience.
The sensor can be installed by just pinning it to the ceiling.
Because it can be easily added to the escort vehicles, it lowers the hurdle for introduction and aims for popularization.
In the future, we will continue to seek cooperation from nurseries and kindergartens, and consider productization.

[Editorial] The construction of the Hikone-Shin-Osaka section of the Hokuriku Shinkansen has been postponed to the fiscal year 2023, and the impact on the city planning in the western part of Fukui Prefecture is starting to be felt.
In the city of Kamihama, where a new station is to be built, the detailed location of the station has not been revealed, and the city plan, which includes the surrounding area, is still in the works.
It is expected to take a long time to formulate the plan, but it is demanded to be announced as soon as possible.
The station in Kamiyamaguchi city that is planned for the Hokuriku Shinkansen will be the only new station in the area west of Kusatsu.

In 2019, the Railway Construction and Transport Facilities Improvement Support Organization indicated a large station location with a radius of about 2.5 kilometers centered on JR East Kami-Hama Station.
We were aiming for winter 22 to determine the exact location of the stations and routes.
In the city of Kamihama, the opening of Shizuoka will be followed by the opening of Kamihama, and the related business of the Shinkansen will be formalized in the 21st year.
With the initial budget for fiscal year 22, they are trying to further increase the number of businesses and advance the city planning to announce the location of new stations.
However, the exact location of the new station has not been revealed yet.

As a city, they are considering the land use and development concept based on the location of the new station, and they have included 3 million yen in this year's budget as a project to formulate a basic plan, but it is expected that it will not be executed.
The city plan centered around the new station will take "time to form a consensus among citizens" (city official).

There is an example of a new suburban station that is not attached to an existing JR station in Etsumi City, but it can be expected that it will take a considerable amount of time to compile the overall concept.
If the public announcement is delayed, the preparation period for opening will be shortened, and there is concern that the impact on the surrounding area will be reduced.
There is a sense of ambiguity about the extension to the west of Tsuruoka before the new station site.
A citizens' group in Kyoto prefecture submitted a petition to the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism last October calling for the withdrawal of the extension plan.

In the political arena of Ishikawa Prefecture, there are calls to reconsider the route, such as receiving a farewell and sending off, and the situation is such that it is difficult to say that the neighboring prefectures are united.

Although the reception of the residents of Kami-Hama to the opening ceremony was relatively calm, there is a concern that the future of the new station will be affected by the unclear location of the new station and the unclear opening date.
Mayor Matsuzaki plans to continue his appeal to the government to open the line as soon as possible, but the voices of the local residents who are demanding an early opening cannot be ignored.
The indifference of "the Shinkansen will someday run west of Tsuruoka" will not move the country, neighboring prefectures, and local governments.
I want to see the enthusiasm to continue to raise their voices.

Cat-shaped meal delivery robot introduced at "Bon-Takai Station Front Store" in Fukui.
The family guests are impressed by the kind expressions and so on = 2-cho, Taishido, Fukui City, Fukui Prefecture
In the food service industry in Fukui Prefecture, which is suffering from a shortage of workers, the introduction of robots that deliver food to tables is becoming more widespread.
The use of robots in the operation of stores and the prevention of COVID-19 infection through "non-contact" service has been well received by families.
A voice from restaurant operators and related parties says, "It is difficult to secure employees and part-time workers at local restaurants, and the delivery robot will further spread."
"Jin, Jin, Jingisu can"!
A robot with a cat face on the screen plays light music while smoothly moving through the store with a tray of food.
When the food arrives at the table, the waiter will say "I have brought your food, nyaa."
The "Kanbon Fukuoka Station Front Store" in 2-cho, Takahama, Fukui City, introduced a cat-shaped meal delivery robot in August 2022.
If a customer has ordered a dish, they can load it onto a robot waiting nearby and press the table number on the screen, and the robot will autonomously drive to the table.
It is equipped with AI (artificial intelligence) voice function, and reacts when touched by the customer, and the cat face on the screen also has a rich expression.
The "Bontagroup" that operates restaurants such as this one has introduced a meal delivery robot at two restaurants, including this one.

Chairman Saito Keiichi said that the reason for the introduction was "the biggest problem is a shortage of workers," and emphasized that it was part of efforts to improve productivity through streamlining and digital transformation (DX).
The ratio of labor costs to sales revenue is usually around 30%, but it can be reduced to 21-22% by introducing this system.

In addition to the role of collecting dishes used by customers, it is also said to contribute to the efficiency of cleanup, and adds "it is also a source of joy for families and children, and has a promotional effect."
The "Rokkan Yama Fukui" restaurant in Shinnohama-cho, Fukui City, which serves grilled meat and hot pot, also introduced a meal delivery robot in August 2022.

Chairman Seong San Yong of the Sonsan store, which is operated as a business, said, "I have been recruiting employees and part-time workers, but not many people have come. I think it is absolutely necessary to introduce it to solve the shortage of manpower."
At the Fukui store, they separate the area where employees serve food and the area where robots deliver food.
The rental fee for robots is the same as the salary of one part-time worker.
In order to reduce the number of employees, the company is considering introducing a tablet-based ordering system and self-checkout machines.

According to the Fukui Labor Bureau, the effective demand ratio for job categories in December 2022 was 6.94 times for "customer service" jobs at restaurants and other establishments, indicating a high shortage of workers.

The person in charge of the network system (Takayama Naka 2-cho, Fukui City) that handles the sales agency for the meal delivery robot said, "Due to the impact of the coronavirus, the shortage of staff at restaurants in the prefecture has become serious, and there has been a lot of inquiries about the introduction of robots."
Star Mountain Chairman analyzed, "It will become even more difficult to secure employees at suburban restaurants in the future, and I think that meal delivery robots will become more popular."
[Editorial] Kanazawa City makes an ending note and distributes it to the citizens who want it.

The "okuyami handbook" which includes a list of necessary procedures and writing styles for when a family member dies, as well as a family tree, was published last year, and many people came to receive it for themselves.

In various parts of the prefecture, lectures on how to write an ending note and how to prepare for death are held regularly, and it seems that "shokkatsu" has become a firmly established practice among the people of the prefecture.
The ending notes for Ending No. 35 in Echizen Town are 35 pages.
The fifth chapter starts with a review of one's own history, and records one's current health and assets, future care, end-of-life medical care, and wishes regarding funerals and graves.
There is also a column to write down things you want to do in the rest of your life and a column to write messages to important people.
I'm not sure if I can write 35 pages, but you don't have to fill up all the pages.
What do you want to leave behind for your family and the people around you?
The most important thing is to make the purpose clear.
In bookstores, there are a variety of notebooks for different purposes, and you can start writing as soon as you find a place to write.
The term "shuukatsu" was coined in 2009, in a similar way to "shuukatsu."
Two years later, in 2011, the Great East Japan Earthquake occurred.
It is said that many people are facing the reality of "death comes suddenly" and are preparing for their own end.
it's been more than 10 years since then.
The new coronavirus pandemic is still raging across the world.
Prices have risen due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and electricity prices this winter have risen to an unthinkable level.
Half of the people are worried about the future because the wages are not increasing as much as the current inflation rate.
On the other hand, in the past, funeral expenses and care expenses could be shared by siblings and relatives, but now it is rare to have a single child.
Also, while life expectancy has increased significantly compared to a few decades ago, there is a dilemma in that the risk of dementia and nursing care increases as people age.
I want to keep in mind that the background of the final act is not a one-time event, but a situation that has been ongoing and has become entrenched.
Regardless, no one wants to burden their partners or children with too much.
The phrase "live your life to the fullest" is a popular keyword for ending notes, but you can't be too self-centered.
I want to write down my hopes and wishes, but I want to talk to my family about it once and prepare for it calmly.

The NPO "Heart of the Collection Editing Bureau" has self-published a book "Dear Prime Minister, the "Life's Breakwater" from Toshinbo.
I have published my 10th book, "From the 'Life's Breakwater' East Seikan Monastery, Dear Prime Minister of the Cabinet."
Each newspaper in the country has picked up the story, and many readers have sent in their comments.

The purpose of this book is to share with you the content I have directly heard from those who have attempted suicide in Japan, regarding the "social and structural" environmental issues that are the cause of suicide, and to create a "society where people can live comfortably".

For 18 years and 10 months, we have been patrolling the waters of Toshinomori, Fukui Prefecture, which is known as a suicide hotspot, to prevent suicide, and have been continuing to support those who have attempted suicide by discovering and protecting them and helping them to reintegrate into society.

This book is a compilation of the issues raised by the 784 people (2/6 currently) who have been protected so far, and as a request to the Prime Minister of the Cabinet Office, it calls for the following seven items to prevent suicide.
(1) Suicide prevention activities are "life-saving" activities.
(2) "Human rights violations" are piling up behind suicides.
(3) Suicides are victims of social and structural organized crime.
(4) The administrative agencies treat the citizens who live outside the jurisdiction as "strangers" and coldly treat them.
(5) People with mental illness such as depression who are drugged and commit suicide are treated as "accidents".
(6) The "duty of care" in suicide hotspots is being forgotten as commercialism takes over.

(7) The parts of the teachings of new religious groups that cannot be scientifically proven are frauds, and the act of threatening to curse the future of the other party and offering them money in exchange for it is blackmail.
The religious group that committed this "fraud and extortion" crime should be publicly denounced and excluded.

Therefore, this book has received many comments from readers, such as "I was moved by the strong mental attitude of those who are involved in this activity," "The former police officer's appearance is a model for police officers," and "He is a bodhisattva who lives like a member of his own family even though he is a stranger," and I would like to introduce one of the comments here.

I've heard that the number of people committing suicide has increased due to the coronavirus pandemic.
it's really sad.
everyone is like that.
I hope that we can live in a society where we can live happily with the lives we have.
I felt respect and gratitude for the staff who have been working hard to help those who are suffering unbearable pain.
I think this activity is a very cruel activity for both the mind and body, but please continue to call out to me in the future as well.
thank you very much.
i'm sorry

Belinohotel: Subsidy for receiving money illegally. County and city lodging support events. Already returned in full. Iwanichi Online. Iwanichinichishinsha.

On the 10th, the prefecture and one municipality announced that the Berry Noho Hotel (Yamaguchi, the city) had been inappropriately using the subsidies for the payment of accommodation expenses for travelers for about a year from October 2021.
When non-eligible people stayed, they would get a discount by having the staff give them a fake name.
It was also confirmed that a large number of employees used the lodging facilities for purposes other than "stimulating tourism demand."

The total amount of 7,231,000 yen in grants that were returned by the prefecture and the city, as well as the hotel's own investigation, was returned by the 6th of this month due to inappropriate use.
The improper receipt of subsidies was the prefectural lodging quota "Iwate Travel Support Project" and the city's emergency lodging quota "First Night Lodging Support Quota".

The period of the investigation was from October 18, 2011 to October 10, 2012 (the first night stay support deduction was on September 30, 2012), and the results of the investigation showed that there were 95 cases of inappropriate use, totaling 587,000 yen, and 1,239 cases of use that did not follow the purpose and goals of the project, totaling 664,400 yen, that were outside the scope of the discount
It was confirmed that the same person was both the user of the lodging fee and the person in charge of the hotel's reception.
The prefecture's detailed investigation revealed inappropriate use, and the city also confirmed the facts after receiving such information.
The city's business has already ended, and the registration for the prefectural business was deleted on December 2 last year.

Regarding the investigation, the representative director of the hotel's operator, Belinno, Takashi Tomizawa, said, "I am very sorry to have caused trouble to the people in the region, the prefecture and the city. I am very sorry. I want to start again from zero and work to restore trust. I plan to hold a compliance training session for all employees."

Chiba Keiya, the head of the promotion department of the prefectural tourism and promotion bureau said, "I am truly sorry. I would like to continue to promote the proper use of the rules and compliance, and to encourage the use of the facilities in accordance with the purpose of the business."
Mayor Sato Shinya commented, "I am truly sorry that there was inappropriate use of the lodging facilities in the city."

Introduction to plant research, including early research by Takayama, and collected materials. Exhibition at the Iwanichi Online City General Cultural Asset Center [Hakodate] Iwanichi Online, Rock Handai Newspaper Co., Ltd.

The exhibition "People who introduced the flowers of Takadaira-san - A brief history of Takadaira-san plant research" which introduces the pioneers who laid the foundation for the plant research of Takadaira-san, a mountain known as a treasure trove of high mountain plants, is being held at the city's general cultural heritage center in Takasu-machi, Hachioji until the 12th.
It introduces the footprints of the predecessors who were involved in the plant research of Saruichigatake mountain, and collects precious samples and other data.

The plant research at the early Taisho period began with the arrival of Russian plant researcher Karl Johann Makishimovich (1827-91) and the collection of plants by Tsukawatamachi-born Sukawa Nagamasa (1842-1925) under Makishimovich's guidance.

Maximovich, who was not allowed to freely walk around the country for foreigners, asked for an interview with Sugawara and continued his research for three years with Yokohama and Nagasaki as his base.
After his return, Sugawara continued to support his research, which led to the announcement of the "Himekozakura", "Nambutouuchiyo", and "Miyamayamabukishouma".

After that, in 1903 (Meiji 36), the modern plant taxonomist Moriya Tomitaro (1862-1957) published "Nambutraono", "Kobanotsukesha", "Nambunazuna", and in 1905 (Meiji 38), he climbed early morning to Mount Takadake and discovered and named "Katouhakobe".
From the exhibition materials, it is clear that many researchers have discovered valuable alpine plants.

Also, the article introduces the plant research of Sakemura Makuzo (1874-1948), the principal of Hakamachi Elementary School who participated in the investigation of natural monuments in 1927 (Showa 2), and the botanical research of Yokokawa Nanoru (1914-1988), who was a curator at the Yokokawa Museum in Daiichi Town and participated in the publication of "Yokokawa's Plants

Yoshida Masahiro, a researcher at the same center, said, "There are many studies behind the names of each plant in the early pool peak mountain, and there are connections between people. It is possible to trace the connections between researchers from local to national."

The exhibition is divided into four chapters, and in the first chapter, the faith and history of the early pool peak are introduced, and in the second chapter, the characteristics of the early pool peak are introduced based on the research of the German geologist Heinrich Edmund von Nauman (1854-1927), who laid the foundation of Japanese geology.

Renewable energy introduction and goal negotiations. Okinawa Airport. Second Carbon Dioxide Reduction Promotion Conference | Society and Economy | Nankai Nippo
Promotion Council for Decarbonization of Amami Airport Discusses Plans = On the 9th, in Kiri-cho, Amami City

The "Kagoshima Airport Decarbonization Promotion Council" (Chairman: Shintani Shuji, Chief of the Kagoshima Prefectural Office's Construction Division, 13 members) held its second meeting at Kagoshima Airport on the 9th, with the aim of reducing greenhouse gas emissions at Kagoshima Airport (Kagoshima City, Kagoshima Prefecture).
All members present, including online.
We held discussions on setting carbon neutrality goals and introducing renewable energy, with solar power generation as the main source.

The Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism has set a goal to reduce the greenhouse gas emissions of each airport by 46% or more by 2030, in order to achieve "carbon neutrality" by 2050.
In response to this, the council held its first meeting in November last year, and is aiming to plan and prepare for the other six airports in the prefecture.
The second meeting will be held in a non-public manner, except for the opening.
According to the chairman of the conference, Mr. Yasutake, after the conference, they will confirm the greenhouse gas emissions of the same airport.
They said that they are pushing forward with negotiations in accordance with the guidelines of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in order to set goals and introduce renewable energy.
According to the distribution data, the CO2 emissions of the facilities and vehicles at the same airport in the fiscal year 2013, excluding aircraft, was 1,476 tons.

Among them, the lighting and air conditioning of the airport terminal building and six other facilities account for about 93% of the total emissions, followed by the aviation lighting of 84 tons and the airport vehicles of 71 tons.
The council will discuss reducing the emissions of these facilities and vehicles.
Chairman Ando said, "We are now at the stage of passing the bill. The direction of the committee is in agreement, and we want to thoroughly compile the interim report."
In the future, we will make a plan to promote the project after receiving opinions on the interim report at the third meeting and the final report at the fourth meeting.
The "Sakasama Immovable Property" branch office in Nagurabuchi, Okinawa Prefecture, is recruiting people who want to borrow a house on the island. Social and economic news. Nankai Nichi Shimbun.
Opening event deepened understanding of "sakasama immovable property" at talk session, etc. = On the 8th, a well-known town

The opening ceremony of the Sakasama Real Estate's Chofu branch office was held on the 8th at the famous community space "entaku" in a famous town, where the real estate company visualized the thoughts of people who want to challenge things like borrowing vacant houses and vacant shops, and recruited landlords.
The operator company will explain the overview of the service through the talk session.

Takahiro Oki, the representative director of Tsuginoba (Likoro-gun, Hokkaido), which is in charge of branch operations, said, "If we carry out this project on the Oki Islands, we can create a movement and flow that will bring people together across the entire island."

Sakasama real estate is the opposite of normal real estate procedures, where the borrower's information is disclosed to the lender and they contact each other to reach an agreement and then sign a contract on their own.
As a pilot project to discover vacant houses and build relationships through them, the company Oncor Co., Ltd. (headquarters in Mie Prefecture) began its service in June 2020.
This is the seventh branch office to open in Kyushu.
It's the first time in the country.

About 20 people, including staff from On-CO and Tsuginoba, and employees from the Yokohama branch of the Yokohama Chamber of Commerce and Industry, as well as local residents, participated in the event.

Daiju Fukube, the representative director, explained the background of the branch opening, saying, "I thought that if we could utilize vacant houses and vacant shops, the town and the island would become more lively as the movement to invite people from outside the island becomes more active."
"I want to connect with people who have property on the island or who want to do something, and help them in any way I can, even if it's just one person or one project."

On-Co's Yamauchi Yusuke said, "We need to discuss how to use each vacant house, what kind of people we want to bring in, and what criteria we use to select them," pointing out the need to discuss the management of the facility.
He called for participation in the talks and cooperation in providing information, saying, "The more people are connected, the more information is gathered."
